content.description: The bottom is slopey/juggy but easy. Once you climb that face get on the good ledge and get your first piece in at about 10 ft.. The crack starts there it's a nice layback crack with jugs and crimps on the face to use also. Climb the crack from the ledge to the top which is about 15 feet above that or so. Gain the top and set up an anchor on one of the trees or the big boulder up there.
content.protection: I used a Grey 10 Stopper, .75 Green Camalot and a #2 Red Camalot. This is why it's Three Pieces. But you can obviously use whatever you want to.
content.location: The left crack, starting half way up it is slightly overhanging

content.description: A crack that begins with a tricky boulder problem then grows progressively easier, as the crack deepens into a left facing corner.
content.protection: Std Rack, or if you boulder it maybe a pad because there is one little boulder sticking out of the ground
content.location: On the Practice Wall; The crack that stretches up the entire face, on the right hand side of the wall, above the rock fin.

content.description:
The obvious right arete on the far right margin of the practice wall. 

  Climb the chunky loose blocks, and step left onto the face then climb the arete following the crack.
content.protection: Nuts. Rock seems too loose for cams.
content.location: Located on the Practice wall, far right.

content.description:
A super chunky crack ascends the right margin of the practice wall, at roughly 10' there is a slight bulge and then easy slab to some trees.

 It's also possible to step left, do some face moves, and climb a fun looking crack that goes straight up.
content.protection: Nuts or toprope. Some of the blocks that make up the crack felt loose, I wouldn't use cams.
content.location: This is the rightmost crack on the main aspect of the practice wall.

content.description:
On the way to Spring Morning Wall you will notice a nice granite wall to your left that has a lot of cracks all over it and very easy looking climbs 

  This is a very good beginner wall take your friends that are new to climbing to this one first
